intro: Calyptranthes multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the wet tropical forests of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are glossy and elliptical, often with a waxy texture, and the plant produces small, woody capsules as fruit.
